name: Georgian Chicken in Pomegranate and Tamarind Sauce
description: This dish, adapted from "The Essential Book of Jewish Festival Cooking," brings an unusual sweet flavor to the Rosh Hashana table. Tamarind paste and pomegranate seeds are readily available at larger supermarkets, and always online.
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon hot paprika or cayenne pepper
3 tablespoons tamarind paste (see note), diluted in 3 tablespoons water
1/2 cup pomegranate paste (see note) diluted in 1/2 cup water, or 1 cup pomegranate juice

recipeInstructions.text: In a large Dutch oven or in a pot with a tight-fitting lid, mix the onions, 1 1/2 cups cilantro, the garlic and the spices. Blend in the diluted tamarind paste, the diluted pomegranate paste, the ketchup and the salt.

Add chicken thighs and legs to pot, and submerge in sauce. Cover, and cook on medium-high heat for 10 minutes, then lower heat, and cook for 1 hour. Uncover, adjust seasonings to taste, and continue cooking for 20 minutes.
Transfer chicken and sauce to a serving platter, and garnish with remaining cilantro. Sprinkle pomegranate seeds over platter, and serve hot.
